form.p: Creates a project for developing with enRoute base profile, a profile for basic OSGi applications. The profile is implemented in different distros . The name of the project must be a Bundle Symbolic Name (e.g. com.example.foo). The last segment of this name has special meaning for the chosen project template.
form.li: *.example — Create an example project with some stub code that demonstrates the key features of OSGi enRoute, like multiple bundles in one project, executable jars, debug configurations, etc. Choose this to play with bndtools/enRoute.
*.api — Create an API project. Use this when you have a service API that should be shared with others, i.e. it must be releasable as a separate bundle.
*.provider | .adapter — Create a provider project. Use this when you create an implementation of a service specification.
*.test — Create an OSGi JUnit test project.
*.application — Create an application project. An application usually contains little or no code but defines configuration, web pages, and dependencies.
